questions.text: In "Les Misérables" what is the name of the man whose prison number was 24601?
questions.explanation:
Jean Valjean.

	Jean Valjean was arrested for stealing some bread.

questions.text: In Roman mythology what is the name of the god with two faces?
questions.explanation:
Janus.

	Janus was the god of gates.

questions.text: This famous comedian who once worked with Dean Martin, now has thousands of "kids". Who is he?
questions.explanation:
Jerry Lewis.

	Jerry Lewis' real name is Joseph Levitch. The "kids" reference is a reference to 'Jerry's Kids', the thousands of people with muscular dystrophy that Jerry Lewis has a telethon for every year to help raise money for research to find a cure for MD.

questions.text: On a season 11 episode of "Cheers", Cliff defined a word as "calling a bald guy Curly?" What word was he incorrectly defining?
questions.explanation:
Juxtaposition.

	According to www.dictionary.com a juxtaposition is "a placing or being placed in nearness or side by side". What Cliff was describing would be antiphrasis.

questions.text: On the US Declaration of Independence who had the biggest signature?
questions.explanation:
John Hancock.

	John Hancock wanted to sign it big enough that the king could see it all the way in England.

questions.text: What is the name of George Jetson's wife?
questions.explanation:
Jane.

	"Meet George Jetson, his boy Elroy, daughter Judy, Jane his wife."

questions.text: In "Pinocchio" what is the name of the cricket?
questions.explanation:
Jiminy.

	Jiminy acts as Pinocchio's conscience.

questions.text: What is the name of the 1996 Christmas movie that starred Arnold Schwarzenegger?
questions.explanation:
Jingle All the Way.

	In 2003, Arnold won the election for governor of California.

questions.text: In the comic strip "Archie" who was Archie's best friend?
questions.explanation:
Jughead.

	Jughead first appeared in December 1941.

questions.text: In the Bible, who was Jacob's only son [besides Joseph] whose name started with a "J"?
questions.explanation:
Judah.

	I always remember the names of Jacob's sons because of the song "Jacob and Sons" in Sir Andrew Lloyd Webber's production "Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat".
